intro: Viola ruralis, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of purple, violet, or white, often with a distinctive yellow center. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Viola ruralis is native to Europe and is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks.
